rules: Rule1: Provided that the budget for the renovation is approved, if it is not the case that the host is not present for the show implies the cameras are operational for the show, then a segment can be filmed for the show.
Rule2: The budget for the renovation is approved, or sponsor funds are provided for the renovation.
Rule3: Whenever sponsor funds are provided for the renovation, if the absence of the host does not entail cameras being operational, then a segment can be filmed for the show.
Rule4: Filming of the show is delayed, or if it is not the case that the table is damaged or production is on schedule, then a replacement table has been found.
Rule5: Under the condition that the host is available for the show, filming of the show is not delayed.
Rule6: The host is available for the show, or a backup host is available for the show.
Rule7: Either the script for the episode is approved, or a backup host being available implies filming is not delayed.
Rule8: Either the electronics have been tested on set, or the equipment has been checked on set.
Rule9: The equipment being checked on set means that tools delivered lead to furniture arrival resulting in production being on schedule.
Rule10: Either the director is onsite for the show, or the assistant director is onsite for the show.
Rule11: Provided that the assistant director is onsite for the show, electronics tested implies tools delivered results in furniture arrival leading to production being on schedule.
Rule12: Filming being able to begin for the show entails that electronics tested means tools delivered results in furniture arrival leading to production being on schedule.
Rule13: Permits have been obtained for the location, or the director being onsite implies filming can begin.
Rule14: Either tickets have been distributed for the show, or promotions are complete for the show.
Rule15: Promotions being complete for the show results in either a live audience being scheduled or production not on schedule leading to audience admission.
Rule16: Filming of the episode is complete, or if it is not the case that the couch needs repair or production is on schedule, then a replacement couch is available.
Rule17: Advertising being approved for the show results in marketing being ready for the show.
Rule18: Marketing being ready for the show means that tickets distributed implies either a live audience is scheduled or production not on schedule leads to audience admission.
Rule19: The host being prepared for the show implies that a backup host being available results in filming not being delayed.
Rule20: The cohost being prepared for the show entails that a backup host being available leads to filming not being delayed.
Rule21: Lighting being ready in the studio implies filming of the show is not delayed.
Rule22: Sound being ready in the studio results in filming of the show not being delayed.
Rule23: The technical crew being ready for the show implies that either lighting is ready or sound is ready in the studio.
Rule24: Either the technical crew is ready for the show, or the production assistants are ready for the show.
Rule25: The production assistants being ready for the show entails that either lighting is ready or sound is ready in the studio.
Rule26: The editor approving the episode implies that filming of the episode is not complete.
Rule27: Either the editor has approved the episode, or the producer has approved the episode.
Rule28: Either the audience is seated in the studio, or the studio is not empty for the show.
Rule29: Either the episode has been filmed for the show, or a live audience is scheduled or production not on schedule leads to audience admission.
Rule30: The rough cut being complete for the episode results in the footage being reviewed for the episode.
Rule31: The final edit being ready for the episode implies the rough cut is complete for the episode.
Rule32: Post-production starting for the episode entails that the episode being filmed leads to the final edit being ready.
Rule33: Editing being underway for the episode implies that the episode being filmed results in the final edit being ready.
Rule34: Color correction being done for the episode results in post-production having started for the episode.
Rule35: Sound mixing being done for the episode implies editing is underway for the episode.
Rule36: Either the episode has been delivered to the network, or color correction is done or sound mixing is done for the episode.
Rule37: The producer approving the episode implies that filming of the episode is not complete.
Rule38: Viewers being allowed in the studio results in the audience being admitted to the studio.
Rule39: Guests being admitted to the studio implies viewers are allowed in the studio.
Rule40: The show having a public screening implies the show is not being privately filmed.
Rule41: The host being present for the show results in the production being on schedule.
Rule42: The cameras being operational for the show implies the crew is ready for the show.
Rule43: If it is not the case that the couch needs repair or production is on schedule, then a replacement couch is not available.
Rule44: If it is not the case that a live audience is scheduled or production not on schedule leads to audience admission, then the studio is empty for the show.
Rule45: If it is not the case that the host is prepared or the cohost is prepared for the show, then rehearsal is complete for the show.
Rule46: If it is not the case that a VIP being present implies guests are admitted to the studio, then the show is being privately filmed.
Rule47: The host not being present for the show implies the crew is not ready for the show.
Rule48: The production not being on schedule results in a VIP being present in the studio.
facts: Fact1: The furniture has arrived on set.
Fact2: The tools have been delivered to the set.
Fact3: Advertising is approved for the show.
Fact4: The show will have a public screening.
Fact5: It is not the case that the couch in the living room needs repair.
Fact6: It is not the case that the table in the dining room is damaged.
Fact7: A replacement table has not been found.
Fact8: The script for the episode is not approved.
Fact9: Permits have not been obtained for the location.
Fact10: The audience has not been admitted to the studio.
Fact11: A live audience is not scheduled for the show.
Fact12: Rehearsal is not complete for the show.
Fact13: The audience is not seated in the studio.
Fact14: The footage has not been reviewed for the episode.
Fact15: The episode has not been delivered to the network.
Fact16: A segment cannot be filmed for the show.
